  • Constructor Details

    • ShipBoard_LevelII

      public ShipBoard_LevelII(FlightBoard flightBoard, Player p)
      Constructs a ShipBoard_LevelII object with the specified flight board and player. This constructor initializes the ship board level by setting up the required non-accessible tiles.
      Parameters:
      flightBoard - the FlightBoard used to initialize this ShipBoard_LevelII
      p - the Player associated with this ShipBoard_LevelII

    • getTotalFirePower

      public float getTotalFirePower(ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> cannonPos, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> batteriesPos, Player player) throws RuntimeException
      Calculates the total firepower of the spaceship based on the cannon positions, batteries positions, and any additional conditions specific to the player or alien type.
      Specified by:
      getTotalFirePower in class ShipBoard
      Parameters:
      cannonPos - a list of lists containing the positions of cannons represented as row and column coordinates.
      batteriesPos - a list of lists containing the positions of batteries represented as row, column, and available charge respectively.
      player - the player whose spaceship firepower needs to be calculated.
      Returns:
      the total firepower calculated as a floating-point value.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if any error occurs during the calculation of the firepower.

    • getTotalMotionPower

      public int getTotalMotionPower(ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> enginePos, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> batteriesPos, Player player) throws RuntimeException
      Calculates the total motion power of the ship based on the provided engine positions, battery positions, and the player's attributes. The motion power is affected by the number of engines and battery charges, and may be modified depending on specific conditions such as alien presence.
      Specified by:
      getTotalMotionPower in class ShipBoard
      Parameters:
      enginePos - A list of positions (row and column) for the engines on the ship. Each position represents an active engine contributing to the motion power.
      batteriesPos - A list of positions (row and column) for the batteries on the ship along with their charges. Used to fulfill the energy demands for the motion power if necessary.
      player - The player operating the ship. Attributes of the player may influence the motion power calculation.
      Returns:
      The total motion power of the ship as an integer. This value is the sum of basic motion power and contributions from engines, batteries, and other applicable conditions.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If any error occurs during calculation, such as invalid data or unexpected conditions.

    • setNonAccessibleTiles

      public void setNonAccessibleTiles() throws RuntimeException
      Sets the non-accessible tiles on the shipboard. This method creates a special tile marked as non-accessible and places it in predefined positions on the shipboard to represent areas that players cannot access. The non-accessible tile is defined with a unique identifier, specific connectors, and a non-accessible type designation. The tile is then inserted at specified row-column coordinates on the board.
      Specified by:
      setNonAccessibleTiles in class ShipBoard
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if there is an issue while inserting the non-accessible tile.

    • removeTile

      public void removeTile(int row, int column, boolean fromMistake) throws Exception
      Removes a specific tile located at the given row and column on the shipboard. This method initiates a state transition to handle the tile removal process, updates the state of the shipboard, and performs necessary updates depending on the type and status of the tile. Additionally, it ensures proper handling of connected blocks and potential mistakes during the tile removal.
      Overrides:
      removeTile in class ShipBoard
      Parameters:
      row - the row coordinate of the tile to be removed
      column - the column coordinate of the tile to be removed
      fromMistake - a flag indicating whether the removal is due to a mistake
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the tile removal process

    • addAlien

      public void addAlien(AlienColor alien_colour) throws RuntimeException
      Adds an alien to the ShipBoard_LevelII based on its color. This method updates the state of the board to reflect the presence of the specified alien color.
      Specified by:
      addAlien in class ShipBoard
      Parameters:
      alien_colour - the color of the alien to be added. Valid values are: AlienColor.VIOLET and AlienColor.BROWN. If AlienColor.VIOLET is passed, the violet alien state is set to true. If AlienColor.BROWN is passed, the brown alien state is set to true.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the operation fails.

    • removeWaitTilesForEndBuilding

      public void removeWaitTilesForEndBuilding()
      Removes the waiting tiles associated with the ship at the end of the building process. If the waiting tiles are present, it detaches the associated ship and updates the count of lost pieces on the ship board. Postconditions: - If `waitTile1` is not null, it is set to null, its associated ship is detached, and the count of lost pieces is incremented by 1. - If `waitTile2` is not null, it is set to null, its associated ship is detached, and the count of lost pieces is incremented by 1.
      Specified by:
      removeWaitTilesForEndBuilding in class ShipBoard
